articles.summary: The Chief Justice of India (CJI) has praised the media for highlighting a controversy over a chapter in an NCERT textbook that discussed judicial corruption. articles.title: RBI's additional liquidity support to wind down after March, bankers say
articles.summary: The RBI’s recent liquidity infusion, which has pushed overnight rates below the repo rate to ease funding stress, is seen by bankers as a temporary, tactical move rather than a policy shift. With surplus liquidity rising above comfort levels and short-term rates cooling, the central bank is expected to maintain this stance only until March before likely absorbing excess cash and restoring its usual liquidity framework.

articles.title: Vismaya, Purvah, Sprng, and Hexa Win CESC’s 600 MW Wind-Solar Auction
articles.summary: Vismaya Renewables India Project, a subsidiary of UPC Renewables, Hexa Climate Solutions, and Purvah Green Power have won Calcutta Electric Supply Corporation’s (CESC) auction to develop 600 MW of interstate transmission system (ISTS)-connected wind-solar hybrid projects under a build-own-operate model. Vismaya Renewables won 100 MW at a tariff of ₹3.74 (~$0.0412)/kWh. Hexa Climate Solutions and Purvah Green Power secured 100 MW and 300 MW, respectively, at a tariff of ₹3.75 (~$0.0413)/kWh.

Vismaya Renewables won 100 MW at a tariff of ₹3.74 (~$0.0412)/kWh. Hexa Climate Solutions and Purvah Green Power secured 100 MW and 300 MW, respectively, at a tariff of ₹3.75 (~$0.0413)/kWh.

articles.title: MCA to roll out one-time scheme for late corporate filings with minimal penalty
articles.summary: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) is introducing a one-time scheme for companies to file their pending annual returns and financial statements. This scheme will run from April 15 to July 15 and will allow companies to pay just 10% of the stipulated penalties. The scheme aims to help companies complete their pending submissions during this period.
articles.raw_summary: The Companies Compliance Facilitation Scheme, 2026, will remain in force between April 15 and July 15. It will allow companies to complete their pending submission of annual returns and financial statements during these three months by paying just 10% of the stipulated penalties, according to a circular issued by the ministry.

articles.title: Government allows export of 25 lakh tonnes of wheat

articles.title: India bond rally halts for RBI outcome; traders eye liquidity measures
articles.summary: Indian government bonds held steady on Friday. Investors await the Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy decision. While a repo rate cut is unlikely, bondholders seek guidance on liquidity. Banks are urging the RBI to adjust regulations to address a deposit shortfall. The central bank has previously infused significant liquidity into the system.

articles.title: PM to launch nationwide HPV vaccination campaign on Feb 28

articles.title: PM Modi to launch nationwide HPV vaccination drive from Ajmer on February 28: Health ministry
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will launch a nationwide HPV vaccination drive for 14-year-old girls from Ajmer on Saturday, aiming to prevent cervical cancer. The initiative, offering a single dose of Gardasil-4, will be voluntary and require parental consent. States and Union Territories will join virtually for this crucial public health campaign.

articles.title: Kerala HC stays ‘The Kerala Story 2’ for 15 days, a day before scheduled release
articles.summary: The Kerala High Court has issued an interim stay on the release of 'The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond', scheduled for February 27. The court observed a prima facie non-application of mind by the censor board in granting certification. This decision follows petitions challenging the film's certificate, citing concerns about its portrayal of religious harmony in Kerala.

This decision follows petitions challenging the film's certificate, citing concerns about its portrayal of religious harmony in Kerala.

articles.title: 'Deep-rooted, well-planned conspiracy to defame judiciary': Supreme Court slams NCERT over corruption chapter in book
articles.summary: The Supreme Court criticized the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) for a textbook chapter on the judiciary, calling it a conspiracy to defame the institution. The court issued a show-cause notice to NCERT officials. The NCERT has withdrawn the revised textbook and is retrieving sold copies.
articles.raw_summary: The Supreme Court sharply criticized the NCERT for a Class 8 textbook chapter on the judiciary, calling it a "deep-rooted, well-planned conspiracy" to defame the institution. The court issued a show-cause notice to NCERT officials. Following the strong remarks, the NCERT withdrew the revised textbook and began retrieving sold copies.

articles.title: Indian state of Kerala to be renamed Keralam to reflect local pronunciation
articles.summary: Proposal approved by Modi government will bring official English name into line with Malayalam language The Indian state of Kerala, known as “God’s own country” for its golden beaches and lush tea plantations, is to be given a new name. Narendra Modi’s cabinet has approved a proposal to change the southern coastal state’s name from Kerala to Keralam. The move will bring the official English name into line with how it is pronounced in Malayalam, the primary language spoken by the state’s estimate

articles.title: No detours: CAFE III to kick in by April 2027
articles.summary: The Indian government has announced that the CAFE III regulations will come into effect by April 2027. Carmakers must meet specific targets for electric and hybrid vehicles, or face penalties. This regulation aims to promote cleaner transportation in India.
articles.raw_summary: Carmakers must meet these targets or face penalties. Electric and hybrid vehicle manufacturers can earn credits. The industry had sought a delay, but the government insists on the timeline. These regulations aim for cleaner transportation.

articles.summary: With the consolidation, Brnd.me will operate under a single Indian holding structure, which the company said will enable greater strategic alignment, operational agility, and governance clarity across its portfolio. According to the company, it reported revenue of about Rs 1,500 crore in FY25 and has turned operating cash-flow positive in FY26.

articles.title: Digital platforms must take responsibility for online content, safety of children: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw emphasized the importance of regulating AI-generated content and ensuring online content safety for children. He highlighted the need for consent when using someone's face, voice, or personality in such content. This discussion may lead to policy changes in India.
articles.raw_summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw also underlined the need to regulate the use of AI-generated content, saying such material should not be generated without the consent of the person whose face, voice or personality is used. Vaishnaw said human society is built on trust in institutions -- from the family and social identity to the judiciary, media and legislature -- all of which operate on the fundamental premise of trust.

articles.title: Eligible manufacturer-importers to get duty deferment facility from March
articles.summary: The Revenue department will offer a 30-day customs duty deferral to eligible manufacturer-importers from March to boost liquidity and manufacturing activity. This move aims to support businesses and stimulate economic growth. The facility is expected to benefit eligible manufacturer-importers in India.
articles.raw_summary: Revenue department to roll out 30-day customs duty deferral for eligible manufacturer-importers from next month to boost liquidity and manufacturing activity.

articles.title: Smallcap AI shares locked in 20% upper circuit on US transport agency deal

The contract is valued at $796,900 and strengthens the company's transportation vertical and US public sector presence. This deal may have implications for India's technology and public sector policies.

articles.summary: The rupee strengthened by 6 paise to 90.85 against the US dollar in early trade on Thursday, driven by a weaker greenback and FII inflows. Positive domestic equity market sentiment also supported the local unit, though rising crude oil prices and geopolitical uncertainties limited significant gains.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel's Rs 20,000 crore NBFC gambit: A Jio-style pivot or costly distraction?
articles.summary: Bharti Airtel is injecting Rs 20,000 crore into its new NBFC, Airtel Money Limited. This move positions the company as a direct lender, competing with established players. Airtel aims to leverage its vast customer base and data capabilities. The company previously acted as a loan distributor. This strategic pivot seeks to capture a significant share of India's underserved credit market.

articles.title: Wingify’s Paras Chopra questions large companies for giving dividends instead of investing in AI research
articles.summary: Wingify's Paras Chopra questioned large companies for prioritizing dividends over investing in AI research during a panel discussion. The discussion featured Peeyush Ranjan, founder of Meraki Labs, and was moderated by ETtech's Samidha Sharma. This highlights the need for companies to invest in AI research to stay competitive.

articles.title: ‘Don't rush to deploy AI build foundations first’: PhonePe CTO Rahul Chari
articles.summary: PhonePe CTO Rahul Chari advises organisations to adopt AI in a phased manner, starting with human-in-the-loop systems. This approach aims to reduce friction and time before progressively removing humans from the loop. Chari's views highlight the importance of careful planning in AI adoption.
articles.raw_summary: According to PhonePe CTO Rahul Chari, organisations should adopt AI in a phased manner, starting with human-in-the-loop systems. “The right approach is to start with human-in-the-loop enablement, reduce friction and time, and only then progressively remove humans from the loop where it makes sense,” he said.

articles.title: Maths and magic meet in Bengaluru as Dr. Martens scales global strategy
articles.summary: Dr. Martens established a Global Capability Centre in Bengaluru, India, to merge its heritage with a digital future. This strategic move, driven by CEO Ije Nwokorie's 'maths and magic' concept, leverages Indian talent for data, analytics, and innovation. The center aims to enhance global operations while preserving the brand's core values of individuality and craftsmanship.

articles.title: Can India’s lawmakers step up global outreach through new friendship groups
articles.summary: For the first time, a concerted effort is underway to build institutional links between Indian parliamentarians and their counterparts abroad. This week, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced the formation of Parliamentary Friendship Groups with 64 countries across continents, with more to follow. articles.title: CESTAT Sets Aside Section 112 Penalty for Lack of Specific Allegations in SCN
articles.summary: The Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal (CESTAT) has set aside a penalty under Section 112 for a lack of specific allegations in the show cause notice. This decision indicates that the tribunal requires detailed imputations in such notices to justify penalties. The ruling has implications for tax authorities and businesses in India.
articles.raw_summary: The Tribunal held that mere mention of Section 112 without detailed imputation in the show cause notice cannot justify penalty. In a press release Worldline said that it will be entering into a long-term technology and software pact with Billdesk, through which Worldline’s software stack will continue to remain operational in India. At an enterprise level the value of the deal was pegged at $43.6 million.

At an enterprise level the value of the deal was pegged at $43.6 million.

articles.title: Who is Arvind KC: The Indian-origin exec named OpenAI’s chief people officer
articles.summary: Arvind KC is appointed as OpenAI's chief people officer, bringing in a veteran operator as the company navigates its next phase of rapid growth. Arvind joins multiple other Indian-origin executives at the ChatGPT-maker, including Vijaye Raji, CTO for applications, and Srivinas Narayanan, vice president.

articles.title: Apple shareholders reject call for report on China manufacturing risks
articles.summary: Apple shareholders on Tuesday ​rejected a proposal to report on the company's dependence ​on China to manufacture most of its products. The vote came after Apple has worked for nearly a decade to broaden its manufacturing base ‌to Vietnam, ⁠India and ⁠the US, where it said earlier that it would assemble some of ​its Mac mini computers to meet US demand starting later this year.

articles.title: India’s semicon business push triggers race for domain experts
articles.summary: India’s semiconductor push is driving a surge in hiring as companies like Micron, AMD, Applied Materials and L T Semiconductor seek specialised talent in chip design, verification and AI accelerators. Demand for system-level engineering skills far outstrips supply. Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a Rs 1,000 crore allocation for the second phase of the India Semiconductor Mission under FY27 to boost capabilities.

articles.title: India not behind in AI race, must focus on deployment: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna
articles.summary: In an interview with ET, IBM CEO Arvind Krishna shrugged off IBM’s 13% stock drop after an Anthropic blog post suggested its AI tool could compress legacy system maintenance timelines, calling the reaction excessive. He also spoke about India’s AI ambitions, the impact on traditional IT services and concerns around workforce disruption.

articles.summary: The debentures will be secured through hypothecation of certain company assets and pledge of promoter shareholding and shares of group companies, including RDC Concrete, Neptune Readymix, and Robo Quarries. The funds will mostly be used to refinance existing borrowings.

articles.title: From road-safety chips to water-from-air, PM Modi reviews cutting edge Israeli tech
Saudi Arabia bans poultry, egg imports from 40 countries, including India; partial curbs on 16 nations
articles.summary: Saudi Arabia has banned poultry and egg imports from 40 nations, including India. This move aims to protect public health and food safety. Some bans have been in place since 2004. The authority will review the list based on global health developments. Processed poultry products meeting health requirements are exempt.

articles.title: Q3 growth seen above 7%: Festive demand lifts economy, but revisions loom
articles.summary: India's economy is poised for robust growth, with expectations of a 7.4% expansion in the December quarter. Festive season demand and Goods and Services Tax adjustments are fueling this positive trend. Economists anticipate continued resilience amid global challenges, with domestic demand and the services sector remaining strong.

articles.title: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal says India has concluded nine free trade agreements covering 38 nations
articles.summary: India has signed nine free trade agreements with 38 nations, opening up access to almost two-thirds of global markets. These pacts will boost Indian goods, services, and talent mobility. Discussions are underway for new agreements, including with Canada. The nation's youth and skilled manpower are seen as key growth drivers. Artificial intelligence is expected to transform jobs, creating new opportunities.

articles.title: ISMA cuts India’s 2025-26 sugar production estimate by 5.5% due to erratic weather
articles.summary: The Indian Sugar   Bio-energy Manufacturers Association (ISMA) has lowered its 2025-26 sugar production forecast by 5.5% due to lower sugarcane yields in Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra. Despite these challenges, net sugar production is still projected to be 12% higher than the previous year, with a significant portion diverted for ethanol production.

articles.title: Revenue growth of India Inc comes at 12-quarter high in Oct-Dec 2025: RBI
articles.summary: India Inc revenue growth: For the last 11 quarters, the revenue growth was coming in single-digits, data from 3,188 such companies analysed by the central bank pointed out, attributing the acceleration to the performance of the manufacturing sector.

articles.summary: The latest 'Flash Report on Central Sector Infrastructure Projects' showed that the revised cost of all 1,702 projects, each valued at Rs 150 crore or higher, monitored by the statistics ministry stood at Rs 39,24,534 crore compared to their original cost of Rs 33,71,816 crore.

articles.title: India cuts sugar production estimate for 2025-26 on weak yields in top states
articles.summary: India sugar output: The third advance estimate, released after an executive committee meeting, follows a second projection of 34.35 million tonnes. Output last year was 29.62 million tonnes.

articles.title: Delhi-Katra Expressway construction on track, will be completed by March 2027: NHAI
articles.summary: India's fifth major expressway, the Delhi-Amritsar-Katra route, will be ready by March 2027. This project significantly cuts travel time between Delhi and Katra to six hours. It connects Sri Harmandir Sahib in Amritsar and Mata Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra. The expressway will also aid faster military movement near the International Border. Construction faced delays but has now regained momentum.

articles.title: Nepal's soyoil exports to India jump tenfold on duty free access
articles.summary: Nepal's soybean oil exports to India saw a massive jump in 2025. Duty-free access allowed Nepal to send record amounts of refined oil to India. This surge helped Nepal's total exports to India double. However, it created challenges for Indian refiners who pay import duties. Nepal's share of India's soybean oil imports increased significantly.

articles.title: Unlocking Rs 40 lakh crore: Govt's mega bet on India's infra future
articles.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman launched the National Monetisation Pipeline 2.0, aiming to raise Rs 16.7 lakh crore by monetising over 2,000 assets. This initiative focuses on operating and maintaining brownfield infrastructure for fixed periods, not privatization, to fund new greenfield projects and boost GDP.

articles.title: Fresh math for world's fastest growing economy: What's behind India's GDP revision and why it matters
articles.summary: India's new GDP revision is set to reflect new way of measuring the economy, shifting the base year for GDP to 2022–23. Authorities will also publish revised figures for earlier years to align them with the new benchmark. The goal is to make the numbers more realistic and responsive to today’s economy, including evolving spending patterns and the expansion of online and tech-driven activity.

The goal is to make the numbers more realistic and responsive to today’s economy, including evolving spending patterns and the expansion of online and tech-driven activity.

articles.title: India now in 'middle ground' after fresh US tariffs but any hike will erode its advantages: UBI Report
articles.summary: India occupies a relative middle ground following the latest tariff developments by the United States, but any uniform tariff hike under Section 122 could increase its tariff exposure and erode some of the advantages gained through earlier negotiations, according to a report by Union Bank of India.

articles.title: ET Graphics: Sitharaman launches infra asset recycling program National Monetisation Pipeline 2.0
articles.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has launched the National Monetisation Pipeline 2.0, aiming for over Rs 16.7 lakh crore in receipts by 2029-30. This ambitious program, a significant increase from its predecessor, will see proceeds allocated across government funds and direct private investment. Key infrastructure assets like major expressways and hydropower stations are slated for monetisation.

articles.summary: India is undertaking a significant exercise to identify gaps in its manufacturing sector. The government is mapping commonly procured goods to understand import reliance. This initiative aims to boost local production and reduce dependence on foreign supplies. A consolidated procurement plan for these items will be developed.

articles.title: Coal exchange rollout should be in phases: Coal India Limited
articles.summary: Coal India envisions a phased National Coal Exchange. This new platform will shift from auctions to electronic trading. Market reforms will be carefully balanced with national energy security. Long-term fuel supply agreements will ensure stability for power producers. The exchange aims for transparent price discovery. Independent regulatory oversight is crucial for its success.

articles.title: WTO establishes panel on India-China dispute on PLI
articles.summary: The World Trade Organisation has agreed to form a dispute panel. China filed a case against India concerning its automotive and renewable energy policies. Beijing claims India's incentive schemes discriminate against foreign businesses. India maintains its measures comply with WTO rules. This development follows earlier consultations between the two nations. The US also commented on China's decision.

WTO sets up panel in China's case against India's certain auto, renewable measures
articles.summary: The WTO's dispute settlement body has established a panel to examine China's complaint against India's automotive and renewable energy sector policies. Beijing alleges that India's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) schemes discriminate against Chinese goods, violating global trade rules. Bilateral consultations failed to resolve the dispute, prompting China's second request for a panel.

articles.summary: The Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways announced modifications to the BOT road project concession agreement, aiming for equitable risk and reward sharing with concessionaires. This initiative, involving Rs 2 lakh crore in projects, will allow for shared profits and losses between contractors and the government.

articles.title: Indian economy now more resilient to shocks, says RBI deputy governor Poonam Gupta
articles.summary: RBI Deputy Governor Poonam Gupta stated India's economy is now more resilient to internal and external shocks, fostering macroeconomic stability and an improving growth trajectory. She highlighted a "virtuous cycle of accelerated growth and macroeconomic stability," supported by a robust banking sector and expanding non-banking space.

articles.title: India launches 1st round of FTA talks with Israel, inks joint statement for GCC pact
articles.summary: India and the six-nation Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) have formally launched negotiations for a comprehensive free trade agreement, aiming to deepen collaboration in trade, services, and investment. In parallel, India is holding its first round of FTA negotiations with Israel, seeking to boost bilateral trade and leverage complementarities in sectors like technology and innovation.

Officials and experts are exploring frameworks for trade in goods, digital services, and innovation-driven technology exchanges.

articles.summary: India and the Gulf Cooperation Council have officially launched negotiations for a comprehensive free trade agreement, signing a joint statement to deepen collaboration. articles.title: Indian textile exporter Gokaldas expects margin lift after US trade deal
articles.summary: Indian textile firm Gokaldas Exports anticipates improved core earnings margins by fiscal 2027. Lower U.S. tariffs under a new trade deal will provide relief. The company expects quarterly margins to rise to the early double digits. This follows a period of margin pressure due to higher tariffs. Benefits are anticipated after the second quarter of fiscal 2027.

articles.title: Nidhi Chhibber takes additional charge as NITI Aayog CEO as BVR Subrahmanyam tenure ends today
articles.summary: Nidhi Chhibber has taken over as the Chief Executive Officer of NITI Aayog. She holds the additional charge following the completion of BVR Subrahmanyam's three-year term. Chhibber is also the Director General of the Development Monitoring and Evaluation Office. This transition marks a new phase for the NITI Aayog leadership.

articles.title: Gold, silver soared in 2025, stocks were major drags. What could 2026 have in store for investors?
articles.summary: After gold and silver delivered spectacular gains in 2025, Indian equities enter 2026 shaped by slower global rate cuts, geopolitical risks and a shift from slowdown to recovery. Largecaps may stay resilient, while mid and smallcaps could benefit from improving consumption trends and banking reforms, though global growth and currency risks persist, a report by 1 Finance suggest.

articles.title: PSU banks better placed on loan-deposit metrics; microfinance cycle nearing normalisation, says Yuvraj Choudhary
articles.summary: Public sector banks in India are showing resilience in their loan-to-deposit ratios compared to private peers. This is a positive sign for the banking sector, but it does not directly relate to any government policy or regulation.

Despite concerns, PSU banks are leading credit growth and demonstrating improved asset quality and return on equity, suggesting a positive near-term outlook.

articles.title: IT will outlast AI hype, private banks beat PSUs: Ajay Tyagi's contrarian playbook
articles.summary: Contrarian investor Ajay Tyagi of UTI AMC remains bullish on Indian IT services, citing historical resilience against technological shifts like AI. He favors leading quick commerce players despite intense competition and sees a positive earnings trend, advocating for private sector banks over PSUs due to their superior return on assets and margin of safety.

articles.title: Rupee stuck in range, missing tech and commodity lift for EM peers
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is showing slight strength today, aided by a weaker dollar. However, it continues to lag behind other emerging market currencies this year. Analysts anticipate this trend to persist in the near term.

articles.title: IRFC OFS open for retail investors today. Should you wait or subscribe?
articles.summary: The Indian government has opened an Offer for Sale (OFS) for a 2% stake in IRFC, with the issue priced at Rs 104. articles.title: Indian IT holds just 1% of global tech value pools: BCG study
articles.summary: India’s tech sector makes up 7% of GDP and 17% of global IT services but captures just 1% of high-growth areas like semiconductors and AI, a BCG study found. Most global tech growth lies outside IT services. Experts question if services-led growth alone can meet India’s $1 trillion tech goal.
